forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 55. North northwest wind 9 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. North northwest wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, the sky unfolds into a canvas of clarity, inviting the gentle embrace of a cool evening. The air is crisp, hovering at a pleasant 55 degrees, with whispering winds from the north northwest weaving through the city streets. It feels invigorating—a subtle reminder of the season's shift toward winter. As night deepens, the faint glow of city lights begins to shimmer, reflecting off the Bay, where the usual veil of fog seems to have receded, giving way to an expansive view that stretches towards the Golden Gate.

Looking ahead to tomorrow, expect a sunny disposition with temperatures peaking around 68 before gracefully falling to a comfortable 64 in the afternoon. The winds will remain steady, gently rustling the leaves and inviting leisurely strolls through the neighborhood, perhaps a visit to a local café to savor aromas of freshly ground coffee or a leisurely afternoon basking in a sunbeam on a park bench. For those venturing out, a light jacket will be your companion, offering warmth as the sun begins to set and the coolness of the bay reclaims its territory. This is a day poised for exploration—ideal for discovering hidden nooks or savoring the architectural beauty that surrounds you, all under the wide, welcoming expanse of a sky that promises clarity and calm.
